question: A 35 yr old pregnant female at 40 weeks gestational age presents with pain and regular uterine contractions every 4-5min. On arrival the patient is in a lot of pain and requesting relief immediately. Her cervix is 5 cm dilated. What is most appropriate method of pain control for this patient
exp: When complete relief of pain is needed throughout labor epidural analgesia is safest and simplest

question: Placenta accreta is associated with all except:
exp: Risk factors for placenta accreta: Present placenta pre Previous H/o cesarean section Previous curettage Previous manual removal of placenta Previously treated Asherman syndrome Myomectomy Multiparity Advanced age Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 394.

question: What is seen earliest in USG?
exp: Yolk sac is the first anatomic structure seen within gestational sac. By TVS, it can be seen as early as 5. 5week By TAS, it is seen by 7 weeks. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 601.

question: All of the following drugs are effective for cervical ripening during pregnancy except:
exp: Ripening of cervix is changing the cervical matrix from sol to gel state by dissolving the collagen bundles making cervix soft. Drugs used for cervical ripening are: Prostaglandin - Dinoprostal gel and Misoprostal tablet Steroid receptor antagonist - Mifepristone, Onapristone Relaxin Glyceryl trinitrite, isosorbide mononitrate Oxytocin Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 525, Datta Obs 9e pg 486.

question: Banana and lemon sign is seen in which fetal anomalies:
exp: Signs of Spina bifida on USG: Small biparietal diameter Ventriculomegaly Frontal bone scalloping or the so called Lemon sign. Elongation and downward displacement of the cerebellum, the so called Banana sign Effacement or obliteration of the cisterna Magna. Ref: Williams Obs 23e pg 354, 355.

question: Ideal number of antenatal visits:
exp: Ideally the schedule of antenatal visits should be: Monthly visit upto 28 weeks Two weekly visit between 28 and 36 weeks Weekly visit from 36 week onwards This means a total of 12-15 visits. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 89.

question: Modified BPS consists of:
exp: Modified biophysical score consists of NST or vibroacoustic non stress test and estimation of amniotic fluid volume using AFI. It takes 10 minutes to perform the score and is used as screening test. Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 342-344.

question: Uteroplacental blood flow at term is:
exp: Using ultrasound to study the uterine aeries, uteroplacental blood flow has been measured to increase progressively during pregnancy from approximately 450 ml/min in mid trimester to nearly 500-700 ml/min at 36 weeks. Ref: Williams Obs 25 e pg 132.

question: The shoest diameter of fetal head:
exp: Bitemporal and biparietal diameters are transverse diameters whereas suboccipitofrontal and occipitofrontal are the anteroposterior diameters Bitemporal diameter is 8 cm Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 77.

question: Intrauterine pressure is raised during labour to
exp: Intrauterine pressure during labor: First stage - 40 to 50 mm Hg Second stage- 100 to 120 mm Hg Third stage - 100 to 120 mm Hg

question: Percentage of women who deliver on the expected date of delivery:
exp: Expected date of delivery is calculated using Naegel's rule i. e, 9 months + 7 days calculated from the 1st day of last menstrual period This rule is based on normal 28 days cycle. In case of women with longer cycle additional number of the days that the cycle extends beyond 28 days is added Based on the formula, labour stas approximately: On the expected date - 4% of cases One week on either side - 50% of cases 2 weeks earlier and one week later - 80% of cases Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 108.

question: Pressure of normal uterine contractions is between 190-300 units. Which unit is being referred here?
exp: 1 Montevideo unit = Intensity of contraction x Number of contractions in 10 mins. It is used to define uterine activity. Clinical labour usually commences when the uterine activity reaches values between 80-120 Montevideo units i. e, 3 contractions of 40 mm Hg every 10 mins. During labour, Normal uterine contractions are between 190-300 Montevideo units. Ref: Williams Obs 23e pg 437.

question: Chadwick sign is seen in:
exp: During pregnancy, due to increased vascularity and hyperemia there is bluish discoloration of vagina called as Chadwick sign. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 42.

question: Fetal blood loss in abnormal cord inseion is seen in:
exp: Normally, the umbilical cord is inseed at the centre of fetal surface of placenta. In Velamentous inseion of cord - the blood vessels are attached to the amnion, where they ratify before reaching the placenta. Whenever patient goes into labour and cervix dilates, there are chances of umbilical cord being injured leading to fetal blood loss. This is called as Bad pre. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 36, 206.

question: Denominator refers to
exp: Bony prominence on the presenting pa is the denominator
opa: Pa of presentation lying over the int os
opb: Relation of different pas of fetus to one another
opc: Bony fixed point of reference on presenting pa
opd: Pa of fetus lying in the lower segmebt of uterus

question: Blood flow in intervillous space at term
exp: A mature placenta has 500 m blood out of which 150 no is in the intervillous space and 350 ml in villi system. Ref: Datta Observe 9e pg 29.

question: What is a placental cotyledon?
exp: Each of the truncal or main stem villi and their ramifications constitutes a placental lobule or cotyledon. Each lobule is supplied with a single truncal branch of chronic aery. And each lobule has a single vein so that lobules constitute functional units of placental architecture. Ref: Williams 24e pg 94.
opa: All branches from one stem villi
opb: Area supplied by one spiral aery
opd: Area drained by one terminal villi

question: CPD in absence of gross pelvic abnormality can be diagnosed by
exp: Best method to rule out CPD is trial of labor Best investigation MRI

question: Which is the most significant finding in cardiotocography for detection of fetal hypoxia?
exp: Late decelerations are smooth falls in the FHR beginning after the contractions has staed and ending after the contractions has ended. They are associated with fetal hypoxemia and potential for perinatal morbidity and moality. Ref: Williams Obs 23e pg 420.

question: Maximum oogonia can be seen in ovaries at:
exp: Maximum number of oogonia are seen at 20 weeks - 6-7 million At bih number is 2 million At pubey - 3-5 lakhs Out of which 400-500 are destined to ovulate Ref: Datta textbook of Obstetrics -9e pg16.

question: Engagement of fetal head is with reference to
exp: Engagement is said to occur when the largest transverse diameter of fetal head crosses the pelvic inlet. Largest transverse diameter of fetal head is biparietal diameter

question: Appropriate material for antenatal diagnosis of genetic disorders includes all the following except:
exp: Prenatal genetic diagnosis can be made by Chorionic villi sampling Amniocentesis Cordocentesis Fetal blood tests -Triple test. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 103.

question: 1 primary oocyte forms how many number of ova:
exp: Primary oocyte formed after meiotic division forms 1 ovum. Ref: Datta textbook of Obstetrics 9 e pg16.

question: Zona hatching occurs:
exp: Zona hatching occurs just before the implantation i. e, 5 days after feilisation. Ref: Datta textbook of Obstetrics - 9e pg24.

question: Karyotyping of fetus can be done through all the following invasive methods except:
exp: Fetal karyotyping can be done by Chorionic villi sampling Cordocentesis Amniocentesis Fetal skin biopsy is done to detect any chromosomal anomaly. It is done between 17-20 weeks to detect serious skin disorders like epidermolysis bullosa, oculocutaneous albinism. Ref: Williams Obs 23e pg 299-301.

question: When fetus is in attitude kf flexion presentation is:
exp: In attitude of flexion presentation is cephalic where as presenting pa is veex

question: Which of the drugs must be available in labour room while giving narcotics for pain?
exp: In a labour room when opoid narcotics are being given to reverse the respiratory depression induced by them, Naloxone should be available. It is given to the mother 0. 4 mg IV in labour. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 479.

question: Size of resting follicle:
exp: Size of resting follicle -0. 02 mm Size of follicle just before ovulation -20 mm.

question: Denominator refers to:
exp: Denominator: It is an arbitrary bony fixed point on the presenting pa which comes in relation with the various quadrants of maternal pelvis. Denominators in different presentations: Occiput in veex Mentum in chin Frontal eminence in brow Sacrum I'm breech Acromion in shoulder. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 70.
opa: Pa of the presentation which lies over the Internal os
opb: Relation of different pas of fetus to one another
opc: Bony fixed point of reference on presenting pa
opd: Pa of fetus lying in the lower segment of uterus

question: All are true about origin and propagation of contractions except
exp: Intensity is greatest at fundus of uterus
opa: The right pacemaker predominates over left
opb: Intensity of propagation is greatest at cervix
opc: The contractiom spreads from pacemaker towards cervix

question: Percentage of water in amniotic fluid:
exp: Composition of amniotic fluid: Water -98-99% Solid -1-2% -Inorganic, Organic, Suspended paicles. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 34.

question: Cesarean section is mandatory in following presentation
exp: In brow presentation, the engaging diameter is Mentoveical diameter which is 14 cms that cannot pass through cervix Hence, cesarean section is mandatory. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 368.

question: Pain in early labor is limited to dermatomes
exp: In early stages of labor pain is mainly uterine in origin. Distributed along the cutaneous nerve distribution T10 - L1 In later stages pain is due to dilatation of cervix referred to back through sacral plexus

question: During active labor cervical dilatation per hour in primi is
exp: Active labor: Cervix dilatation to atleast >6 cm Regular uterine contractions are present Rate of dilatation is atleast 1. 2 cm/hr for nulliparous and 1. 5cm/ hr for parous women

question: After how many days of ovulation embryo implantation occurs
exp: Implantation is the process by which the blastocyst penetrates the uterine mucosa to get implanted in the endometrium. It stas on 6- 7 day after ovulation. Ref: JB Sharma Obs pg 20.

question: HcG is secreted by:
exp: Synctiotrophoblasts are the principal site of protein and steroid hormones in pregnancy HcG is synthesized by synctiotrophoblast. Ref: Dutta Obs 9 e pg 53.

question: Primigravida with full term, complains of faintness on lying down and she feels well when turns to side or sitting position. This is due to
exp: Supine hypotension syndrome: During late pregnancy, the gravid uterus produces a compression effect on the IVC when patient is in supine position. In 90% cases, this results in opening up of the collateral circulation by means of paraveebral and azygos veins. In 10 % cases, when collaterals fails to open up, the venous r. Return Ofthe hea may be seriously cuailed. This results in production of hypotension, tachycardia and syncope -Supine Hypotension Syndrome. The normal blood pressure is quickly restored by turning the patient to lateral position. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 49.

question: All of the following are included in first stage of labor except
exp: Crowning is a cardinal movement of labor which occurs during second stage

question: The prerequisites for internal rotation of the head all are except
exp: Tone of abdominal muscles doesnot correspond to internal rotation of head

question: When fetus is in attitude of flexion, presentation is:
exp: The pa of the fetus which occupies the lower pole of the uterus is called the presentation of the fetus In an attitude of flexion the presention is Cephalic Ref: Dutta Obs 9e pg 69.

question: Uterine blood flow at term:
exp: Uterine blood flow is increased from 50 ml/min in non pregnant state to about 750 my near term. Ref: Datta Obs 8e pg 61.

question: Most common cause of postpaum hemorrhage is:
exp: Most common cause of primary postpaum hemorrhage is Atonic uterus Most common cause of secondary postpaum hemorrhage is Retained placenta Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 393.

question: Number of fontanelles present in a newborn child is:
exp: Wide gap in the suture line is called as Fontanel. In a newborn there are 6 fontanelles Among which two are of obstetric significance. They are - Anterior fontanelle - Posterior fontanelle Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 77.

question: True labour pains include all except:
exp: True labour pains: Cervical dilatation Regular and gradual increase in duration and frequency of contractions Bag of water is formed Associated with show Painful uterine contractions. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 110.

question: Human placenta is best described as
exp: Human placenta is discoid in shape hemochorial because of direct contact of chorion with blood maternal deciduate i. e, it is shed at the time of paurition. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 25.

question: Which of the following trigger onset of labour?
exp: Fetal ACTH acts on fetal adrenal gland causing release of DHEA and DHEA sulphate which are used by the placenta along with the other enzymes like Sulfatase, Aromatase, 3 B hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase, 17 B hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase -Conveing into Estriol and Estardiol that help in triggering the labour. Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 108-109.

question: Indication for the induction of labour is:
exp: Indications for induction of labour: Pre-eclampsia /eclampsia Abruptio placenta PROM Chorioamnionitis Chronic hydromnios/Oligohydromnios Post maturity Congenital malformation of fetus Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 523, Datta Obs 9e pg 485.

question: Bag of membranes ruptures
exp: Membranes usually rupture after full dilatation of cervix or sometimes even beyond in second stage

question: Insulin resistance in pregnancy is because of:
exp: During pregnancy, insulin levels are increased because of increased insulin secretion as well as increase in insulin resistance due to number of contra insulin factors. These are Estrogen Progesterone Human placental lactogen Coisol Prolactin The main hormone responsible for insulin resistance is HPL. Ref: Dutta Obs 9e pg 55.

question: The perineal injury can be prevented in normal labour bya all except
exp: An episotomy will increase the risk of tear into external and spinchter or rectum or both. Conversely anterior tears involving urethra and labia are more common in women in whom an episotomy is not cut. So timely episotomy as a routine should not be done and it should be individualised
opc: Slow delivery of the head in between contractions

question: Assesment of progress of labor is best done by
exp: Paogram is the best method to assess progress of labor

question: In Bishop's score all are included except:
exp: Bishop's score is a quantitative prediction of successful induction of labour. It includes Cervical dilatation Cervical position Cervical effacement Head station Cervical consistency. Ref: Williams Obs 23e pg 502.

question: Percentage of women who deliver on expected date of delivery
exp: EDD is calculated using Naegle's rule

question: Ritgen maneuver is done in:
exp: Ritgen maneuver is done for delivery of head in normal labour to allow controlled delivery of head When the head distends the vulva and perineum enough to open the vaginal introitus to a diameter of 5 cm or more, a towel draped gloved hand maybe used to exe forward pressure on the chin of the fetus through the perineum just in front of coccyx. Concurrently the other hand exes pressure superiorly against the occiput. It also ours neck extension so that the head is delivered with its smallest diameters passing through the introitus and over the perineum. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 130.
opb: For delivery of head in breech presentation
opc: For delivery of legs in breech presentation
opd: For delivery of head in normal labour

question: At what level of b-HcG is it that normal pregnancy can be earliest detected by TVS (Transvaginal USG):
exp: Critical titre of HcG: For visibility of Gestational sac TVS -1000-1200 IU/ml TAS -6000 IU/ml Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 601.

question: The term placental sign denotes:
exp: All the pregnant females have amenorrhea. In a few pregnant females however, cyclic bleeding occurs upto 12 weeks of pregnancy i. e, until the decidual space is obliterated by the fusion of decidua vera with decidua capsularis. Such bleeding is usually scanty, lasting for shoer duration than the usual cycle and roughly corresponds with the date of the expected period. This is called placental sign. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 60.
opa: Alteration of FHR on pressing the head into the pelvis
opb: Spotting on expected date of period in early months of pregnancy
opc: Permanent lengthening of the cord in 3 rd stage of labour
opd: Slight gush of bleeding in 3 rd stage of labour

question: Information obtained by lateral plate X-ray pelvimetry are all except:
exp: Bispinous diameter can be measured by anteroposterior view and not on lateral view of X-ray pelvimetry. X-ray pelvimetry is useful in cases with fractured pelvis and for the impoant diameters which are inaccessible to clinical examination. Ref: Dutta Obs 9e pg 329.

question: Earliest of fetal hea can be detected at:
exp: When the question says - Cardiac activity is earliest detected at it means it's about TVS (Transvaginal sonography), which is seen at 6 weeks. Ref: Callen 4e pg 119, 120.

question: Uterine contractions are clinically palpable when there intensity is more than?
exp: Uterine contractions are palpable when intensity exceeds 10 mm. Hg Uterine contractions become painful when intensity exceeds 15 mm. Hg Intrauterine pressure at which uterus becomes hard that it cannot be indented by figure -40 mm. Hg. Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 498.

question: The nerve roots blocked in pudendal nerve block is
exp: Pudendal nerve arises from S 2, 3, 4 roots

question: Weight of the placenta and fetus are equal at:
exp: In the first trimester, placental growth is more rapid than that of the fetus. But by approximately 17 weeks, placental and fetal weights are approximately equal. Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 95.

question: Time taken for spermatogenesis is:
exp: Spermtogenesis takes on average of 70-80 days (75 days).

question: The following statements are related to obstetric inversion:
exp: Uterine inversion is a condition in which there is a inside out turning of the uterus. It is a rare cause of postpaum collapse but collapse occurs suddenly after labour It is acute in onset Mostly uterine inversion is complete, i. e, third degree Most common cause of uterine inversion is mismanagement of third stage of labour Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 395.
opa: It is usually insidious in onset
opd: In majority, it is spontaneous in nature

question: Double bleb sign in USg are depictive of:
exp: Double bleb sign: Visualization of gestational sac containing a yolk sac and amniotic sac giving an appearance of two small bubbles. Feature of an intrauterine pregnancy. Distinguishes a pregnancy from a pseudogestational sac or decidual cast cyst. Ref: Williams 24e pg 170.

question: During spermiogenesis, mitochondrion of spermatid forms which pa of the sperm
exp: Nuclear body forms Head of the sperm Golgi body forms Acrosomal cap Mitochondrion forms Middle piece of sperm Microtubules form Axial filament of sperm.

question: During the active phase of labor the minimum effective dilatation of cervix in primigravida should be at the rate of
exp: Effective dilatation of cervix in a primigravida during active phase of labor is 1cm/hr

question: Atonic uterus is more common in:
exp: Multigravida leads to postpaum hemorrhage due to laxed abdomen Inadequate retraction and frequent adherent placenta contribute to it. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 385.

question: Best marker of gestational age in 2nd trimester is:
exp: In the second trimester the BPD most accurately reflects the gestational age, with a variant of 7-10 days. Prediction of gestational age by USG: 8-12 weeks - Crown rump length measurement Second trimester -BPD, HC Third trimester - Femur length Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 198.

question: Main source of prolactin in amniotic fluid is:
exp: Decidua is the main source of prolactin present in amniotic fluid. Decidual prolactin is not confused with human placental lactogen(hpl) which is produced only by the synctiotrophoblast. Ref: Williams Obs - 24 e pg 88.

question: Perineal tear should be repaired:
exp: Perineal tears should be repaired immediately following the delivery of the placenta In cases of delay beyond 24 hrs, the complete tear should be repaired after 3 months Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 397.

question: Assessment of progress of labour is best done by:
exp: Paograph is a graphical record of cervical dilatation and descent of head against the duration of labour in hours. It gives information about fetal and maternal condition which is recorded in a sheet of paper. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 122.

question: Feilised ovum reaches the uterine cavity by:
exp: Zygote enters the uterine cavity in the form of Morula on 4 that day after feilisation. Ref: Datta Obs 9 e pg 24; JB Sharma Obs of 19.

question: Which type of the pelvis is associated with increased incidence of face to pubis delivery?
exp: Anthropoid pelvis: AP diameter is more than that of transverse diameter Direct occipitoposterior position is more common Non-rotation is common More incidence of Face to pubis delivery Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 325.

question: Placenta succenturiata may have all except:
exp: Placenta succenturiata is a condition in which one or more small lobes of placenta are placed at varying distances from the main placental margin. If it is retained it leads to...... PPH Sub involution Uterine sepsis Polyp formation Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 205.

question: The first stimulus in IUL for Leydig cells to produce testosterone:
exp: The first stimulus for leydig cells to produce testosterone is HcG The main stimulus for leydig cells to produce testosterone is LH.

question: A case of 35 week pregnancy with hydromnios and marked respiratory distress is best treated by:
exp: As the patient has respiratory distress and the gestational age is 35 weeks -fetal maturity has not acquired our main aim is to relieve the distress continuing the pregnancy to atleast 37 weeks. This can be achieved by Amniocentesis - drainage of good amount of liquor. Ref: Dutta Obs 9e pg 203.

question: The smallest diameter of true pelvis is:
exp: True conjugate - 11cm Diagonal conjugate -12 cm Inteuberus diameter -11cm Interspinous diameter -10 cm Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 32-33.

question: Decidual space is obliterated by:
exp: Decidual space is the space between decidua capsularis and parietalis seen in early pregnancy because the gestational sac does not fill the uterine cavity. By 14-16 weeks the gestational sacred has enlarged to fill the uterine cavity completely by 4 th month (16 weeks). Ref: Datta Observe 9e pg 22.

question: Uterine contractions are clinically palpabel when there intensity is more than
exp: Uterine contractions: Palpable when intensity exceeds 10 mm Hg Painful when exceeds 15 mm Hg

question: Most impoant component of Bishop score
exp: The most impoant component of bishop score is dilatation of cervix

question: The major contribution of amniotic fluid after 20 weeks of gestation:
exp: Origin of amniotic fluid: Early week -Maternal plasma 2 nd trimester - Fetal skin Beyond 20 weeks -Fetal urine Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 34.

question: The nerve roots blocked in pudendal nerve block is:
exp: Pudendal nerve arises from S2, 3, 4 roots Pudendal block will block all the roots. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 480.

question: A 35 year old pregnant female at 40 weeks gestational age presents with pain and regular uterine contractions every 4-5 min. On arrival, the patient is in lot of pain and requesting relief immediately. Her cervix is 5cm dilated. What is the most appropriate method of pain control for this patient?
exp: When complete relief of pain is needed throughout labour, epidural analgesia is safest and simplest. Ref: Williams Obs 24e pg 513.

question: Factors which help in descent of presenting pa during labour are all except
exp: Factors facilitating descent are Uterine contraction and retraction Bearing down effos Straightening of the fetal ovoid specially after rupture of membranes

question: Ritgen maneuver is done in
exp: Ritgen manuever is done for delivery of head in normal labor to allow controlled delivery of head. When the head distends the vulva and perineum enough to open the vaginal introitus to a diameter of 5cn of more, a towel is drapled, gloved hand may be used to exe forward pressure on the chin of fetus through the perineum just in front of coccyx. Concurrently the other hand exes pressure superiorly against occiput. This ours nect extension so that the head is delivered with its smallest diameter passing through the introitus and over perineum
opb: For delivery of head in breech presentation
opc: For delivery of legs in breech
opd: For delivery of head in normal labour

question: Commonest cause of non engagement at term, in primi is:
exp: In primi's the most common cause of non engagement at term is deflexed head or occipitoposterior position followed by cephalopelvic dispropoion. Ref: Datta Obs 9e pg 330.
